sentence: Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) will begin trading ex-dividend on April 23, 2015.
A cash dividend payment of $0.6629 per share is scheduled to be paid on May 15, 2015.
Shareholders who purchased PG prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an 3% increase over the prior quarter.
At the current stock price of $83.08, the dividend yield is 3.19%.
The previous trading day's last sale of PG was $83.08, representing a -11.51% decrease from the 52 week high of $93.89 and a 7.49% increase over the 52 week low of $77.29.
PG is a part of the Basic Industries sector, which includes companies such as Unilever PLC ( UL ) and Unilever NV ( UN ).
PG's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $3.3.
Zacks Investment Research reports PG's forecasted earnings growth in 2015 as -5.58%, compared to an industry average of -2.1%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the PG Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
